summary: Antonio Veciana was the founder of Alpha 66, an anti-Castro Cuban exile group. He is of interest to the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence (SSCI) and the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) in the context of inquiries into the assassinations of President John F. Kennedy and Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Veciana's connections to Cuban intelligence networks and related materials held by the NSA are under scrutiny. The NSA reviewed material related to Veciana in response to SSCI requests, including Cuban material from 1961-1965. He is also connected to William Gaudet, as indicated in a CIA cable providing headquarters traces on both individuals. Veciana's biographical information is of interest to the CIA.
significance: Antonio Veciana's significance in the JFK context lies in his role as the founder of Alpha 66 and his potential connections to Cuban intelligence networks, making him a person of interest in investigations into possible Cuban involvement in the assassination.
